definition: abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan

sentences.english: He wanted to do a time recording equipment, a good make up for lack of a sundial.
sentences.chinese: 他就想再做一件记时器具，好弥补日晷的不足。

sentences.english: The sundial's nocturnal counterpart, the water clock, was designed to measure temporal hours at night.
sentences.chinese: 到了晚上，则用水钟取代日晷，量测晚上的真时。

sentences.english: A close up of the sundial which is very accurate, by the way.
sentences.chinese: 日晷的近景，它走时非常精确。

sentences.english: The shadow on this sundial showed the time to the minute precisely!
sentences.chinese: 由这个日晷的阴影显示出来的时间，精确到了分钟。

sentences.english: By the sundial the solar term can be known too.
sentences.chinese: 该日晷还能确定当时所处的节气。

sentences.english: It is evolved and designed based on horologe and the ten Heavenly Stems timing in China.
sentences.chinese: 它是以中国日晷与天干计时为基础进行演化与设计的。

sentences.english: So the sun returned ten degrees, by which degrees it was gone down.
sentences.chinese: 于是前进的日影，果然在日晷上往后退了十度。

sentences.english: There are several kinds of sundials.
The sundial is the oldest known device for the measurement of time.
sentences.chinese: 日晷是已知的最古老的一种测算时间的装置。

sentences.english: Direction when you put your sundial in place.
sentences.chinese: 方向时，你把你的日晷到位。

sentences.english: Behold, I will bring again the shadow of the degrees, which is gone down in the sun dial of Ahaz, ten degrees backward.
sentences.chinese: 就是叫亚哈斯的日晷，向前进的日影往后退十度。

sentences.english: Definitely. Later on, the sun - dial and hour glass were invented.
sentences.chinese: 后来有人发明了日晷仪器和沙钟。

sentences.english: The natural objects belief of Confucius mansion mainly involved sacrificing the Big Dipper and sundial.
sentences.chinese: 孔府的自然物信仰主要包括祭北斗和祭日晷。

sentences.english: So the Nightingale flew over to the Rose-tree that was growing beneath the Student's window.
sentences.chinese: 于是夜莺就朝那棵生长在古日晷器旁的玫瑰树飞去了。

sentences.english: A sundial showed very precise time.
sentences.chinese: 日晷上显示的时间非常精确。

sentences.english: And it was in ancient Egypt that the first recorded 2)sundials were found.
sentences.chinese: 最早的日晷是在古埃及发现的。

definition: star chart/also written 星相圖|星相图
the world's first seismograph invented by Zhang Heng 张衡 in 132/abbr. for 候風地動儀|候风地动仪
